sec.title: 2013 AADE Election Dates
sec.p: Please see below for the 2013 AADE election dates. For more information, visit www.diabeteseducator.org.
March 1: Application deadline for 2013 AADE elections; applications are due.
May 15: Voting opens for 2013 AADE elections.
June 17: Voting closes for 2013 AADE elections.

sec.title: Go for the Gold and Be Rewarded for Your MY AADE NETWORK Activity
sec.p: Through the rest of 2012, MY AADE NETWORK is hosting a contest that rewards your participation! This is an exciting way to reach AADE members and nurture your professional development and relationships.
MY AADE NETWORK helps you stay on the cutting edge of your practice by making all resources easily and quickly accessible. Earn points toward gold, silver, and bronze medals in several ways:

list-item.p: Post new threads and reply to active threads.
Subscribe to discussion forums.
Rate and comment on blogs.
Connect with other AADE members.
And more!

sec.p: At the end of 2012, eligible users will be entered into a drawing to win a tablet!
For more information, visit www.diabeteseducator.org.

sec.title: Insulin Pump Therapy Advanced Course Launched
sec.p: Insulin Pump Therapy is now available! Earn CE while learning the ins and outs of insulin pump therapy from an expert in the field. Developed by Gary Scheiner, MS, CDE, this latest AADE online course is divided into 6 self-study modules:

list-item.p: Module 1 addresses the evolution of insulin pumps, weighs the clinical benefits and potential patient challenges, and discusses device selection.
Module 2 covers patient selection and education, pump selection, infusion device options, and insulin choices.
Module 3 describes pump initiation, including transition planning, technical training options, use of an infusion device, safety guidelines, and forward planning.
Module 4 discusses glucose regulation, including principles of adjustment, basal fine-tuning, bolus fine-tuning, and advanced feature application.
Module 5 focuses on the patient and challenges of pump use. The needs of special populations are addressed.

Module 6 examines the view from the office: downloading and analyzing data, pump and supply costs, insurance coverage, reimbursement for technical training, and clinical care. The module concludes with a handy resource guide.

sec.p: Available to AADE Members for $249 (a $90 savings). Visit www.diabeteseducator.org/advanced6.
Additional online training:

list-item.p: Continuous Glucose Monitoring (12 CE), AADE member price: $295 (save $120)
Gestational Diabetes (4 CE), AADE member price: $149 (save $50)
Inpatient Diabetes Management (4 CE), AADE member price: $149 (save $50)
Coming soon: DSME Program Management

sec.p: Bulk discounts available for all groups of 3 or more. To learn more, e-mail memberservices@aadenet.org.

sec.title: Spanish-Language App for Your Patients Available Now
sec.p: You can reinforce the education you give to your Spanish-speaking patients by directing them to download this mobile app, which presents the AADE7 Self-Care BehaviorsTM in Spanish.

The app provides facts, tips, and activities for 7 healthy behaviors that will help your patients improve their lives and the lives of their family members. This app will build on the messages you give your patients and will be available to them 24/7!
Following are the AADE7 Self-Care Behaviors™:

list-item.p: Healthy eating
Being active
Monitoring
Taking medications
Problem solving
Risk reduction
Healthy coping

sec.p: For more information about the app, including screen shots and a flyer you can give to your patients, go to www.diabeteseducator.org/app.
The app is available in the Apple and Android stores for only $.99
To Download the app, go to the Android store or the Apple Store and search for “AADE.” Pick the app named “Diabetes & Me” from the list of search results.

sec.title: New Recorded Webinars
sec.p: Available at your convenience, AADE recorded Webinars will keep your expertise up to date and your busy schedule on track. New recorded Webinars are always being added. Check out some of our newest offerings that are now available. See these and more at www.diabeteseducator.org/recorded5.

list-item.p: Cardiovascular Disease and Diabetes: Medications and Healthy Eating
Cardiovascular Disease and Diabetes: Treatment Goals and Guideline
Diabetes Management After Gastric Bypass
Gestational Diabetes: Current Guidelines & Recommendations
How to Incorporate Community Health Workers into DSME/T Programs
Type 2 Diabetes in Children

sec.p: In addition, AADE offers several recorded Webinars free of charge to members:

list-item.p: Agents of Change: Systems and Strategies to Address Family, Social, and Developmental Needs in the Type 1 Pediatric Population
Best Insulin Injection Technique: Teaching the Long and the Short of It
Concepts and Controversies in Type 2 Diabetes: Experts Review the Evidence
How to Cook Like a Pro in a Healthy Cooking Demo
Insulin Therapy, Patient Education, and Treatment Individualization: The Next Generation
New Pathways to Type 2 Diabetes Control: Focus on the Kidney
Top 10 Foods That Reduce the Risk of Heart Disease
What Diabetes Educators Need to Know About the Real-World Application of GLP-1 Receptor Agonists in Type 2 DM
Top 10 Foods That Reduce the Risk of Heart Disease
What Diabetes Educators Need to Know About the Real-World Application of GLP-1 Receptor Agonists in Type 2 DM

sec.title: AADE Publications Connect You to Diabetes Care and Education
sec.p: AADE’s publications and online resources ensure that you have the information you need to succeed throughout your career in diabetes care and education.
Stay connected to the latest in diabetes care and education with must-have books and electronic titles:

list-item.p: The Art and Science of Diabetes Self-Management Education Desk Reference
Managing Diabetes: Complications and Comorbidities
Quick Guide to Medications
Practical Spanish for Diabetes Educators
Dictionary of Diabetes Education
CQI: A Step-by-Step Guide
Diabetes Educator Review Guide
Diabetes Education Curriculum
And many more!

sec.p: AADE Members receive significant discounts on products. For more information, visit www.diabeteseducator.org/products.

sec.title: New Free Online Service for Members: Your Own Personalized Web Page
sec.p: At AADE12, Health Monitor Network (AADE’s partner in patient education and publisher of the member-benefit magazine, Diabetes Health Monitor; bi-monthly circulation 1.5 million) introduced a FREE online service that can help AADE members communicate effectively with patients while promoting their practice.
This service allows AADE members like you to create their own personalized Web page. The features will enable you to

list-item.p: Send patients and other HCPs to your Web page through our “Find a Diabetes Educator” link as well as your own personalized Web address.
Manage your online presence and offer high-quality patient education, savings, tools, and important information to your patients.
Determine how to share your background, education, accreditations, affiliations, accepted insurance plans, community events, and more.

sec.p: It’s easy to set up, it’s secure, and it’s offered free by a trusted AADE partner. To learn more, visit www.healthmonitor.com/AADE/welcome.

sec.title: Are You Taking Advantage of Your Capella University Member Benefit?
sec.p: Diabetes means new fears, increased risks, and a different way of life. Build the skills to help patients—and communities—adapt, manage, and thrive. Explore diabetes nursing options from Capella University.
Lead the way in diabetes care and prevention. Capella offers the only online MSN and the only RN-to-MSN Diabetes Nursing degree programs.

list-item.p: Diabetes Nursing Certificate
MSN Diabetes Nursing
RN-to-MSN Diabetes Nursing

MSN General Nursing with emphases in
Nurse Educator and Diabetes Nursing
Nursing Leadership and Administration and Diabetes Nursing
Gerontology Nursing and Diabetes Nursing

RN-to-MSN General Nursing with emphases in
Nurse Educator and Diabetes Nursing
Nursing Leadership and Administration and Diabetes Nursing
Gerontology Nursing and Diabetes Nursing
